solution_04_inferential_statistics/05_exam4/01_one_mean_ci_pval_v1

\[n=8\] \[\text{df}=7 \]

\[t^\star = 2.36\] \[\bar{x} = 199.2413\] \[s = 1.0239\]

\[\text{CI}_\text{bounds} = \bar{x}\pm \frac{t^\star s}{\sqrt{n}} \]

\[\text{CI}_\text{bounds} = \text{(198.385, 200.097)}\]

\[t=\frac{\bar{x}-\mu_0}{s/\sqrt{n}}=\frac{199.2413-200}{1.0239/ \sqrt{8}}\] \[t = -2.096\] \[p\text{-value}= P\left(|T|>2.096\right) \] \[p\text{-value} = 0.074 \]


  1. 198.385243
  2. 200.097257
  3. 0.0743129
  4. The p-value is more than 0.05, so the difference is NOT significant. /
